intro: Pouzolzia, commonly known as the groundsel or rockweed, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These plants are typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils or in coastal areas. Pouzolzia species are characterized by their small, often hairy leaves and yellow or white flowers that bloom in compact clusters. They are adapted to withstand drought conditions and can thrive in poor soil conditions. Some species of Pouzolzia are used in traditional medicine for their potential health benefits.
